net.cassite.style.util

Class RegEx

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cassite.style.util.RegEx

  • public class RegEx
extends java.lang.Object
    A Reg expression supporter that simplifies usage of RegEx
    and make it look like doing regex in JavaScript
    Author:
    wkgcass

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RegEx(java.util.regex.Pattern pattern, boolean isGlobal)
      initialize the regex with given Pattern object and set whether it means global
      All patterns in java are global
      RegEx(java.lang.String regex)
      initialize the regex with given string in the form of a regex JavaScript
      e.g.
      RegEx(java.lang.String regex, int mask)
      initialize the regex with given string in the form of a regex JavaScript
      e.g.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String[] exec(java.lang.String toExec)
      same as JavaScript exec
      java.util.regex.Matcher getMatcher(java.lang.String str)
      get matcher of the given string
      java.util.regex.Pattern getPattern() 
      boolean matches(java.lang.String toMatch)
      check if the string fully matches this regex pattern
      java.lang.String replace(java.lang.String str, java.lang.String replacement)
      replace the found substring with replacement
      for global regex, invoke Matcher.replaceAll(String)
      others, invoke Matcher.replaceFirst(String)
      boolean test(java.lang.String toTest)
      same as JavaScript test
      simply invokes Matcher.find()

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • RegEx

        public RegEx(java.lang.String regex)
        initialize the regex with given string in the form of a regex JavaScript
        e.g. / .* /g
        g for global, i for case insensitive, m for multiline, s for dotall, d for unix_lines, u for unicode_case
        Parameters:
        regex -

      • RegEx

        public RegEx(java.lang.String regex,
             int mask)
        initialize the regex with given string in the form of a regex JavaScript
        e.g. / .* /g
        Parameters:
        regex -
        mask - masks defined in Pattern
